body_html:
Thanks for the review! I updated the test.

The test wasn't failing before because the "sparse" test was creating a sparse vector that was actually dense (i.e. it's of size 2 and values are being specified for both indices). FWIW it looks like a number of other optimizers (at least Adam, LazyAdam) have the same shortcoming in their tests.

Thanks for the review! I updated the test. 

The test wasn't failing before because the "sparse" test was creating a sparse vector that was actually dense (i.e. it's of size 2 and values are being specified for both indices). FWIW it looks like a number of other optimizers (at least Adam, LazyAdam) have the same shortcoming in their tests.
